Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the similarities between Bernie Sanders and Joe Biden on key issues such as taxes, health care, the Green New Deal, abortion, and guns.
Understate: The claim may understate the differences between Bernie Sanders and Joe Biden on other issues, including tax policy, free college tuition, and aspects of their health insurance plans.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that there is "no daylight between" Sanders and Biden on the mentioned issues.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that having similar stances on a few key issues means there is no significant difference between the two candidates overall.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may ignore alternative explanations for the similarities between Sanders and Biden, such as the broader alignment of the Democratic Party on certain policy issues.
